result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Patrick Paar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher Patrick Paar is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher Patrick Paar was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Notify Agent as soon as possible about conviction
- Reserves on sentence credit

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: St. Croix Count case 21CF500.

10:12 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Fox, Defendant Christopher Patrick Paar in court.  Attorney Scott Selmer in court for Christopher Patrick Paar.  Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin. There is an agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NO CONTEST to Ct 1 - Bail Jumping.  DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reviews felony conviction. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 - Bail Jumping. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Counts 2 and 3. Sentencing recommendations. 
Court Orders: S/W 2 years probation with conditions to run concurrent with 21CF500.
- Court Costs: $268, payable through DOC. 
- DNA Surcharge: $250, payable through DOC
- DNA Sample
- AODA (already completed, if accepted) and comply with treatment plan. Maintain compliance.
- Test randomly and regularly to monitor sobriety
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested by agent.
- Absolute sobriety

Notify agent as soon as possible about this conviction. Advised of right to appeal. Court reserves on presentence credit.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing  random ETG testing at least 1 times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.
